intro: Gonocalyx megabracteolatus, commonly known as the giant bract gonocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest in botanical studies and horticulture.
